title: Phase 3: Handle save() error
description:
Change save() to return error, print to stderr on failure so user knows if work is lost.

Files: internal/tui/tui.go, internal/tui/tui_test.go
Success: Save errors printed to stderr, test for error path

Ref: plans/2026-01-12-tech-debt-cleanup.md#phase-3

title: Phase 6: Coverage push to 85%
description:
Refactor main.go for testability and add CLI tests.

File: cmd/fabbro/main.go

Refactor to realMain() pattern:
func main() {
    os.Exit(realMain(os.Args[1:], os.Stdin, os.Stdout, os.Stderr))
}

func realMain(args []string, stdin io.Reader, stdout, stderr io.Writer) int {
    // ... all logic here
}

Add tests for:
- CLI command parsing
- Error paths (not initialized, bad session ID, etc.)
- init when already initialized
- review without --stdin flag

Success:
- just check-coverage passes (≥85%)
- go test ./... passes

Ref: plans/2026-01-12-post-tracer-features.md#phase-6

title: Add CONTRIBUTING.md with dev workflow
description:
Create contributor guide.

Content:
- Development setup (just setup)
- Testing workflow (just test, just test-all)
- Pre-push hooks (lefthook)
- Conventional commits format
- Spec-driven development process
- Code review expectations

Source: AGENTS.md has the workflow documented

title: Phase 3: SPC command palette
description:
Add Helix-style SPC menu for annotation discoverability.

File: internal/tui/tui.go

- Add modePalette to mode enum
- SPC key opens palette overlay
- Palette shows: [c] comment [d] delete [e] expand [q] question [k] keep [u] unclear
- k (keep) is ONLY available via palette
- ESC dismisses palette
- Any annotation key triggers that action

Tests:
- SPC opens palette mode
- Pressing 'c' in palette triggers comment
- ESC dismisses without action

Ref: plans/2026-01-12-post-tracer-features.md#phase-3

title: Phase 2: fabbro init command
description:
Implement fabbro init command.

See: plans/2026-01-11-tracer-bullet.md (Phase 2)

Files:
- cmd/fabbro/main.go: root cobra command + init subcommand
- internal/config/config.go: IsInitialized(), Init()

Behavior:
- Creates .fabbro/sessions/ directory
- Idempotent (prints 'already initialized' if exists)

Tracer bullet scope:
- NO config.yaml (defer)
- NO templates/ (defer)
- NO .gitignore (defer)

Success criteria:
- go test ./... passes
- fabbro init creates .fabbro/sessions/
- Running again prints 'already initialized'

title: Document Claude Code integration
description:
Document how to integrate fabbro with Claude Code.

Location: docs/claude-code-integration.md

Content:

title: Phase 5: Multi-line selection
description:
Replace single-line selection with range selection.

File: internal/tui/tui.go

Change from 'selected int' to:
type selection struct {
    active bool
    anchor int  // where selection started
    cursor int  // current end of selection
}

Behavior:
- v toggles selection mode
- In selection mode, j/k extends selection from anchor
- ESC clears selection
- Any annotation key operates on selected range

View changes:
- Highlight all lines in selection range
- Status bar shows 'N lines selected'

Tests:
- v starts selection at current line
- j/k in selection extends range
- annotation applies to full range

Ref: plans/2026-01-12-post-tracer-features.md#phase-5

title: Phase 4: Minimal TUI
description:
Implement minimal TUI with bubbletea.

See: plans/2026-01-11-tracer-bullet.md (Phase 4)

File: internal/tui/tui.go

Keybindings (tracer bullet only):
- j/k: navigate lines
- v: toggle line selection
- c: add comment (opens text input)
- w: save and exit
- q: quit without saving

Model state:
- content []string
- cursor int
- selected int (-1 if none)
- annotations []Annotation
- mode string (normal|input)
- input string

UI layout:
─── Review: abc123 ───
  1 │ Line content
  2 │ Selected line  ← SELECTED
  3 │ Another line
──────────────────────
[v]select [c]omment [w]rite [q]uit

On save: insert FEM markup, write to session file

Success criteria:
- go test ./... passes
- TUI displays, navigates, accepts comment, saves

title: Phase 1: Fix q/Q quit keybinding conflict
description:
Change quit from q to Q (shift+q) so q is available for question annotation.

- Change quit keybinding from 'q' to 'Q'

Tests:

- q no longer quits

title: Phase 4: Remove custom max()
description:
Delete custom max() function - Go 1.22 has builtin.

Files: internal/tui/tui.go
Success: grep 'func max' internal/ returns nothing

Ref: plans/2026-01-12-tech-debt-cleanup.md#phase-4

title: Phase 4: Improved navigation
description:
Add page navigation and jump commands.

File: internal/tui/tui.go

Keybindings:
- Ctrl+d → scroll down half page
- Ctrl+u → scroll up half page
- g → start g-pending mode
- gg (g then g) → jump to first line
- G → jump to last line

Implementation:
- Track gPending bool in model
- Any key other than g clears pending state

Tests:
- Ctrl+d moves cursor down by half viewport
- gg moves to line 0
- G moves to last line

Ref: plans/2026-01-12-post-tracer-features.md#phase-4

title: Phase 5: FEM Parser
description:
Implement FEM parser for comment annotations.

See: plans/2026-01-11-tracer-bullet.md (Phase 5)

File: internal/fem/parser.go

Types:
- Annotation{Type, Text, Line}

Function:
- Parse(content string) ([]Annotation, cleanContent string, error)

Tracer bullet scope:
- Only parse {>> comment <<} markers
- Other annotation types deferred

Parsing strategy:
- Regex-based for tracer bullet
- Find {>> ... <<} patterns
- Extract text, determine line number
- Return clean content with markers stripped

Success criteria:
- Test: {>> hello <<} extracts annotation with text 'hello'
- Test: multiple annotations on different lines
- Can parse session file created by TUI

title: Document CLI commands and flags
description:

- fabbro resume <session-id>
- fabbro sessions [--list]
- fabbro show <session-id>

Include exit codes and error messages.

Source: specs/03_tui_interaction.feature

title: Phase 7: Integration Test
description:
Implement tiered testing strategy per plans/2026-01-11-testing-strategy.md

Tiers:
- Tier 1: Unit tests (default, <1s, 98% coverage)
- Tier 2: Integration tests (//go:build integration, <10s)
- Tier 3: Property-based/fuzz tests (//go:build fuzz, <5s)

Total budget: <15s for all tiers.

Commands:
- just test (Tier 1)
- just test-integration (Tier 2)
- just test-fuzz (Tier 3)
- just test-all (all tiers)
- just check-coverage (enforce 98%)

title: Phase 6: fabbro apply --json command
description:
Implement fabbro apply --json command.

See: plans/2026-01-11-tracer-bullet.md (Phase 6)

File: cmd/fabbro/main.go (apply subcommand)

Behavior:
- Load session by ID
- Parse FEM annotations
- Output JSON to stdout

JSON format:
{
  "session_id": "abc123",
  "annotations": [
    {"type": "comment", "text": "...", "line": 2}
  ]
}

Success criteria:
- go test ./... passes
- fabbro apply <id> --json outputs valid JSON
- Annotations from TUI appear in output

description:

title: Phase 2: All 6 annotation types
description:
Add remaining annotation types to parser and TUI.

2.1 Parser (internal/fem/parser.go):
- Add patterns for delete, question, expand, keep, unclear
- All 6 types: comment, delete, question, expand, keep, unclear

2.2 TUI Model (internal/tui/tui.go):
- Add Type field to Annotation struct
- Add markers map for type-to-FEM-syntax mapping
- Update save() to use correct markers per type

2.3 TUI Keybindings:
- d → delete (prompt: 'Reason for deletion:')
- q → question (prompt: 'Question:')
- e → expand (prompt: 'What to expand:')
- u → unclear (prompt: 'What\'s unclear:')
- k (keep) is palette-only (Phase 3)

Tests:
- Parser tests for all 6 annotation types
- TUI tests for all keybindings

Ref: plans/2026-01-12-post-tracer-features.md#phase-2

title: Phase 3: fabbro review --stdin command
description:
Implement fabbro review --stdin command.

See: plans/2026-01-11-tracer-bullet.md (Phase 3)

Files:
- cmd/fabbro/main.go: review subcommand with --stdin flag
- internal/session/session.go: Session struct, Create(), Load()

Session struct: ID, Content, CreatedAt
Session file format (.fem):
---
session_id: abc123
created_at: 2026-01-11T10:00:00Z
---
<content>

Behavior:
- Check initialization, error if not
- Read stdin, create session file
- Launch TUI (Phase 4)

Success criteria:
- go test ./... passes
- echo 'test' | fabbro review --stdin creates session in .fabbro/sessions/
